selected_quotes: Cancer in 2nd breast less likely with #tamoxifen use for BRCA1/2 carriers

citation.abstract: To determine whether adjuvant tamoxifen treatment for breast cancer (BC) is associated with reduced contralateral breast cancer (CBC) risk for BRCA1 and/or BRCA2 mutation carriers.
citation.title: Tamoxifen and Risk of Contralateral Breast Cancer for BRCA1 and BRCA2 Mutation Carriers

blogs.title: Tamoxifen May Lower Breast Cancer Risk In BRCA Mutation Carriers
blogs.summary: Researchers have shown that tamoxifen, a common breast cancer therapy, may reduce breast cancer risk in women who inherited BRCA mutations.

blogs.title: Breast cancer drug works for high-risk women

news.title: New role for tamoxifen in saving high-risk breast cancer patients
news.summary: The global study was led by University of Melbourne and the Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre and published in the Journal of Clinical Oncology. The study involved about 2,500 women from Europe, North America and Australia who have inherited mutations in...

news.title: New role for Tamoxifen in saving high-risk breast cancer patients
news.summary: New research has revealed women with a strong genetic predisposition to breast cancer who take the cancer prevention tablet tamoxifen after their first tumour, have a substantially reduced risk of developing a new breast cancer.

news.title: Risk of Second Cancer Lower in BRCA Carriers on Tamoxifen (CME/CE)
news.summary: (MedPage Today) -- Women with BRCA1 or 2 mutations had fewer contralateral breast cancers while on tamoxifen for secondary prevention, observational data showed.

news.title: Tamoxifen cuts second cancer risk in BRCA carriers
news.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters Health) - Taking tamoxifen is tied to a sharply reduced risk of a second breast cancer among women who carry the BRCA1 or BRCA2 "breast cancer genes," new research shows.

news.title: New role for Tamoxifen in saving high-risk breast cancer patients
news.summary: New research has revealed women with a strong genetic predisposition to breast cancer who take the cancer prevention tablet Tamoxifen after their first tumor have a substantially reduced risk of developing a new breast cancer.

news.title: Study shows tamoxifen prevents breast cancers in many women
news.summary: The global study was led by University of Melbourne and the Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre and published in the Journal of Clinical Oncology today.

news.title: Tamoxifen for prevention in high-risk breast cancer
news.summary: The global study was led by University of Melbourne and the Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre and published in the Journal of Clinical Oncology. The study involved about 2,500 women from Europe, North America and Australia who have inherited mutations in BRCA1

news.title: Tamoxifen cuts second cancer risk in BRCA carriers
news.summary: Taking tamoxifen is tied to a sharply reduced risk of a second breast cancer among women who carry the BRCA1 or BRCA2 "breast cancer genes," new research shows.

news.title: Anti-cancer drug halves risk
news.summary: WOMEN at the highest risk of breast cancer who take anti-cancer drug Tamoxifen can halve their risk of developing cancer in the other breast, Melbourne researchers have found.

news.title: New role for Tamoxifen in saving high-risk breast cancer patients
news.summary: ( University of Melbourne ) New research has revealed women with a strong genetic predisposition to breast cancer who take the cancer prevention tablet Tamoxifen after their first tumor have a substantially reduced risk of developing a new breast cancer.

news.title: Drug offers prevention hope for women with BRCA breast cancer gene
news.summary: Use of the anti-cancer drug Tamoxifen is associated with a dramatically reduced risk of developing a second breast tumour among women with a high risk gene mutation who have experienced breast cancer already, a new study has found.

news.title: BRCA Gene No Death Knell in Long Term (CME/CE)
news.summary: (MedPage Today) -- Women with BRCA-mutated breast cancer lived just as long as women who were not BRCA carriers, particularly mutation carriers who underwent prophylactic oophorectomy, a study of more than 3,000 breast cancer patients showed.

facebook.title: Tamoxifen and Risk of Contralateral Breast Cancer for BRCA1 and BRCA2 Mutation Carriers
facebook.summary: Tamoxifen Cuts Risk for Breast Cancer in BRCA Carriers

facebook.title: Tamoxifen and Risk of Contralateral Breast Cancer for BRCA1 and BRCA2 Mutation Carriers
facebook.summary: This study provides evidence that tamoxifen use is associated with a reduction in CBC risk for BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutation carriers. Further follow-up of these cohorts will provide increased statistical power for future prospective analyses.
